senses.de: To be the responsibility of someone
senses.ex: It may fall to me to break the bad news.

Tips.title: Unexpected Duty
Tips.description: Use 'fall to' when an unplanned responsibility arises, especially in a group context.
Tips.example: When the chef got sick, it fell to Angela to cook dinner.

Tips.title: Reluctant Task
Tips.description: 'Fall to' can imply a task isn't eagerly accepted but done out of necessity or obligation.
Tips.example: It fell to me to apologize to the neighbors.

senses.de: To begin doing or working on
senses.ex: After a short prayer, they fell to their dinner.

Tips.title: Commencing Activity
Tips.description: Use 'fall to' to express the start of an activity with vigor or enthusiasm.
Tips.example: After the bell rang, students fell to discussing their holiday plans.

Tips.title: Focused Involvement
Tips.description: 'Fall to' suggests immersion or getting deeply involved in the next action.
Tips.example: The team fell to analyzing the data right after the meeting.

senses.de: To lose value, to decrease in number or intensity
senses.ex: The stock market fell to 100 points today.

Tips.title: Market Fluctuations
Tips.description: When used in a financial context, 'fall to' denotes a negative change in value.
Tips.example: Oil prices fell to their lowest this year.

Tips.title: Negative Milestone
Tips.description: 'Fall to' emphasizes reaching an undesirable or lower point.
Tips.example: Attendance at the event fell to just a handful of people.

senses.ex: Many soldiers fell to enemy fire.

Tips.title: Facing Adversity
Tips.description: 'Fall to' can reflect defeat or being overpowered, often in a grave or somber situation.
Tips.example: The last of the defenders fell to overwhelming forces.

Tips.title: Consequence of Conflict
Tips.description: It's especially poignant in historical or military contexts, indicating loss or death.
Tips.example: Many fell to the plagues that swept through the land.

senses.de: To pass to a certain state or condition
senses.ex: With the leader gone, the country fell to chaos.

Tips.title: Descent into Chaos
Tips.description: 'Fall to' can describe how things go from order to disorder or from a better to worse state.
Tips.example: The ancient city fell to ruin over the centuries.

Tips.title: Dramatic Change
Tips.description: Use it to depict a stark, often sudden change in the state of affairs or condition.
Tips.example: When the law was abolished, the district fell to lawlessness.
